topic.title: SpaceX (night launch)
topic.body:
SpaceX is now targeting Thursday 1:35 am ET, March 16th for the EchoStar XXIII launch.

(note: SpaceX will not attempt to land Falcon 9’s first stage after launch due to mission requirements)

http://www.spacex.com/webcast

topic.title: Zer⨁ (features & requests)
topic.body:
Added
=====

- Featured sidebar
- Auto scroller
- Image preview
- Theme (plain, simplified layout)
- Homepage images (thanks kai0's request!)

Requests
========

- Logo (Z+, Zer⨁, etc, etc)
- More sidebar stuff (...popular, mod, admin, stats)
- Moderator functions (kai0)
- Video support (kai0)
- Banner randomizor (bot)
- Theme selector (bot)
- Countdown timer function (bot)
-  ...

Bugs
====

- Sidebar featured links are made on the fly... fixing.

Goal
====

- Everything loading dynamically, ie. less page reloads.

Github
=====

- Updated (18th March 2017):  https://github.com/kustomzone/ZeroPlus

.

topic.title: ZeroMe Feed Bot (repost)
topic.body:
This is a python script that will turn a ZeroMe Profile into a RSS feed reader.
- (refer issue: #31:  https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/31 )

**RSS**

[How to Subscribe to RSS Feeds](http://rss-tutorial.com/rss-how-to-subscribe-to-feeds.htm)

> RSS (Rich Site Summary; originally RDF Site Summary; often called Really Simple Syndication) uses a family of standard web feed formats to publish frequently updated information: blog entries, news headlines, audio, video. An RSS document (called "feed", "web feed", or "channel") includes full or summarized text, and metadata, like publishing date and author's name. Src:Wiki

**How to Install:**

1. Backup your ```/path/to/zeronet/data/users.json```, delete it and restart ZeroNet. Create a new ID (ZeroID, KaffieID, etc).
Clone a hub (*Don't mess up existing hub, newcomers will be disappointed when they find only Robots and Zombies in the public timeline.* Also you can control your post storage limit with your own hub, or suffer this ```content.json: Include too large 277327 > 50000 ... Sign failed: Invalid content``` XD), then login ZeroMe with your new ID and your hub.

2. Create a folder named ```FeedBot``` under your ZeroNet root directory:
```$ cd /path/to/zeronet && mkdir FeedBot```

Download the [script file ↗](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/FeedBot/feedbot.py) or [copy it from Nullpaste](http://127.0.0.1:43210/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?user_binchan2@zeroid.bit) to the folder, open it with your fav editor. Copy your hub ```address```, new ID ```auth_address``` and new ID ```auth_privatekey``` (you can find them in the new ```users.json```) respectively to

```
SITE_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_KEY = b''  # key needs to be byte
```
Also under ```FeedBot``` folder create an empty file named with ```rssAddresses.txt```.

3. Add your feeds:
There are two way to add your feeds:
One way is to directly copy your feed url to ```rssAddresses.txt```, one url one line.
The other way is to create post with your bot ZeroMe account. The format is ```add-feed YOUR_FEED_URL```. 
Your can also delete your feed with ```del-feed URL```. That's cool, isn't it ;)
You can also use your major ZeroMe account to add and delete feed url. Check the code to add the feature by yourself :P

4. Backup ```/path/to/zeronet/data/users.json```, restore your major ```users.json```.

5. Run the script:
Install package dependency ```feedparser: $ pip install feedparser``` or with other method. Then simply run it with ```$ python feedbot.py```. If you want to run it periodically, you can use ```$ watch -n TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND -x python feedbot.py```. The script normally won't fetch anything if there are no new content. But some websites don't support ```etag``` and ```last-modified header```, the script has to always fetch feeds from them, but still won't update anything.

**Screenshot:**
[Screenshot](http://127.0.0.1:43210/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/merged-ZeroMe/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/data/users/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1492140736.jpg)

**Bugs:**
 Unknown

**Todo:**
- Also add Feed Summary (300-500 character limit).
- Keyword filters especially for large websites.
- Remove posts with keyword
- Set limit of post size

**Recommendation:** 
Any?

**License:**
MIT

(by binchan2@zeroid.bit)

topic.title: ZeroMe Mastodon Bridge (repost)
topic.body:
Another python script :3 This script gives you the power to cross post between ZeroMe and Mastodon, which means when you post something on ZeroMe, it will also post to your Mastodon account, and vice versa.
What is Mastodon? It's a Twitter-like, that based on OStatus protocol, distributed social network, and recently its user base and development are exploding. For more information check [its github repository](https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/).


**How to Install:**
Unlike Feedbot.py, this time the installation is quite simple. First you need to have an account from [a Mastodon instance](https://github.com/tootsuite/documentation/blob/master/Using-Mastodon/List-of-Mastodon-instances.md). Then create a folder named ```ZeroMe-Mastodon-Bridge``` under your ZeroNet root directory: 
```
$ cd /path/to/zeronet && mkdir ZeroMe-Mastodon-Bridge
```
Download [the script file ↗](https://git.gnu.io/chbinnc/Userscripts/raw/master/ZeroMe-Mastodon-Bridge/zeronet-mastodon-bridge.py) or [copy it from Nullpaste](http://127.0.0.1:43210/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?user_binchan2@zeroid.bit) to the folder, open it with your fav editor. Copy your hub ```address```, ID ```auth_address```, ID ```auth_privatekey``` (you can find them in the ```users.json```) and your Mastodon instance website address respectively to

```
SITE_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_KEY = b''  # key needs to be byte

MASTODON_SITE = ''
```

Then install dependent packages ```html2text``` and ```Mastodon.py``` like with ```pip install html2text --user && pip install Mastodon.py --user```. That's all. Finally run the script with ```$ python zeronet-mastodon-bridge.py```, just in the first time it will ask you to input your username and password of your Mastodon account. Also I suggest you keep repeating the script with ```$ while sleep TIME_INTERVAL_IN_SECOND; do python zeronet-mastodon-bridge.py; done```. The script doesn't support Python 2. If you insist using Python 2, you need to slightly change the code by yourself.


**Bugs and Troubleshooting:**

Currently Mastodon doesn't support markdown, so your post from ZeroMe to Mastodon won't be well formatted. But in contrast post from Mastodon to ZeroMe will be formatted, thanks to html2text, though it may still have some bugs. Also Mastodon limits post to 500 characters by default.


**Todo**

- Image support is possible
- ZeroMe API


**License:**

MIT


**A Small Proposal:**

Currently ZeroMe still has not many users (though I also like small community), and most hubs have quite heavy limit to content size. But I believe ZeroMe is still quite a promising project . Besides keep improving performance and adding functions, similiar to using same protocol like traditional email service, Diaspora* with Friendica (Friendica also supports connecting to many other websites, before it could also hack Facebook, but later Facebook built some high wall...) and Hubzilla, Mastodon with StatusNet, Gnusocial and Quitter. In the long term it may be better that ZeroMe and ZeroNet can communicate with other distributed (social) network, or just P2P (social) network. Therefore ZeroMe and ZeroNet project won't become an isolated island.

(by binchan2@zeroid.bit)

> [kai0](#comment_17_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): i think for you finish this to For venture capital is better

You and i both know Zeronet has great potential. Yet when you say so Kaffie said this should stay free, no market.
People say it's like the early internet, and that thinking is same. But i put 1 year to learn what i know, and now next week
i have to move for unpaid rent. I have brother who makes a living coding at home, but it's taken nearly two decades for
both of us to get this skilled. Then that guy left yesterday saying there are bugs (troll?) and said he's no coder.
Making a job site, app store, crypto-currency, and so on is the best hope to code while paying rent.
Thankfully you do understand that. :D

Yes, there was one guy on reddit who said they were bringing online gambling to Zeronet from normal web.
Said their coder was working on it, but it never happened.

So the funny thing happened when i looked back at the old ZeroHello from 1 year ago (early Feb) that nofish had a market zite placeholder. "Coming Soon". But that had sat on the homepage for a year until he upgraded (March) to what we see today.
And he removed that zite header. No one else has come close to making. I thought i have to jump in quick while i can.

> [kai0](#comment_18_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): i know, i run my own besiness after school,i know entrepreneur not easy.that guy maybe is market player, he don't know this kind of thing, but i believe many people watching zeronet, they just waiting for opportunity。

If we believe what he said then he's been checking carefully each service he mentioned, and from an 'endusers' perspective.
I mean that sounds like someone who is serious, but as you say, they won't move until Tamas does the TED talk, and (maybe) gets
some exposure on TED YT channel ("1 million views") and then we'll see if there's a viable audience for VC.

Nofish was paid web designer. That's how he honed his skill. He's just understanding the marketing side involves lots of time and publicity, which is new for him. I suspect from his age that he was learning web language from very young age, and typically it's self-taught skill until company job, then thinking how to do his own way for a few years until he had confidence and some savings.

> [kai0](#comment_20_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): Nofish was paid web designer，that’s not easy for him to dev zeronet.

I mean he must have learned HTML and stuff in late 90s when dot-com bubble.. (i mean studying as child) 
My age is older, but i've been self-taught since i was teenager. Had to learn gfx, audio, video, backend, frontend, you name it.
Zeronet removes a lot of the complexity, but nofish uses some complex frameworks. (and coffeescript, python)
I spent a month or two last year learning both of those. Then some months researching Electron. (to make Fuzium)
Pretty much a solid year doing nothing else 7 days a week. That's why i sing his (Tamas') praises. 
His code takes a lot of time to understand. It's one reason there are few developer on Zeronet.
I use UC Browser, and before that Maxthon. They both use Chrome. Are you on Chinese browser too?

19_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv.body:
Admin may be tricky.. we have rights to the content in our own user folder, and db mirrors that user data.json, but user accessing another user's data is probably restricted within zeronet core.

In the case of Fuzium (which runs zeronet) it's my own copy of zeronet, where i hack the wrapper.html. I can do that because it's not the default zeronet. So it probably depends on what protections nofish has put with the access via zeroframe (API).

> [kai0](#comment_77_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): i know, zeronet not let other person delete post, only owner can delete, that's why just let admin move post  to another page, don't show on homepage.are there  any Component for setup admin? if there are, that's easy,  just bring  to your site.

While i believe Kaffie is wrong about ZN not being suited to money making ventures, it still requires a well-planned strategy.

I felt compelled to rebuff twiggydew's complaints because i have long history with so many frameworks and languages and hosting experiences. Zeronet is as simple as it can be. Member and Admin level CMS will improve, but in my mind there's no reason why hosting companies couldn't start offering that level of control. Probably twiggydew is an existing hosting provider who is looking to get a free app to extend his/her service. That's the issue i have. Why should i, or anyone (other than nofish who has vested interest and already income) want to make a platform that a hosting company could use, when i've struggled to pay for hosting for years, and had to teach myself every aspect of coding to be able to start my own hosting and zite dev service. There's no point me making admin easy and clonable without having my own strategy for that first.

Images on the homepage is one thing, and while admin is not too difficult, it's not something i can give away without starting my own service first. In order to get there i've made several zites (which are not so popular btw) ..but have that very direction in mind.

code editing: http://localhost:43210/1NFUSEDZjmCFJE1JSG5UjwCRK6zDwQRQd7
sqlite editor: http://localhost:43210/1SQEEKkYzZuwo7X37EcET5wP6B3yAJZYo

ZeroMe has enough aspects of CMS to complete a hosting management package. No one here (on ZN) has even talked about such a thing, but i've been working steadily towards that very goal.

1) Increase ZN popularity.
2) Learn all basics.
3) Offer dev service and "guaranteed" (peer) hosting.
4) (small, but deserving) Profit.

Whether a strategy like this works, we'll see.

So.. setting up admin (moderator) is quite a step, but i can judge better the amount of time now that i've tried avatars.
A decent attempt might take around one or two weeks.

> [kai0](#comment_115_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): yes, it's not easy.

it would definitely need clean start on another address. hacking it in works up to a point, but you can see the struggle.
Spent about 2 hours today trying to get working on older version of ZN-0.5.1 but it failed completely. Very frustrating. (???)

1_1Lr88ePoU9FsXzkUPsENX5xLcei8jtxeTM.body: I guess some people publish and don't know how to check, even though it's in the sidebar and where it says failed. In a few case the site had maybe 1 peer and that person deleted or moved, but i don't think it would be common. Some case the missing file was not signed for some reason. (eg. "ignored" in content.json)

> [4tee2](#comment_1_1Lr88ePoU9FsXzkUPsENX5xLcei8jtxeTM): Yeah, I was wondering if it was maybe offline people that had few peers. But the experience we've had with 50 peers found and then index.html can't be downloaded??? That seems somewhat like a bug...

There could to be some issue with how peering is handled in the network when we publish. The time-stamp on the most recently published copy is supposed to propagate and replace all others, but i can imagine situations in some large networks where there are islands of people who are self-connecting easily, but are not so easily connecting with the small number of peers who receive a newly published copy. So a zite could be popular enough to expect it to be well peered across the network, but the high numbers of peers might also, somehow, work against that.

20_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb.body:
(copy) **feedbot.py**

```
#! /usr/bin/env python

# Check http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:22:ZeroMe+Feed+Bot for details

import feedparser
#import html2text

import os
import subprocess
import inspect
from datetime import datetime
import time
import json

SITE_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_KEY = b''  # key needs to be byte


# Update rssAddresses if there are new ones in last posts,
# Then store address and etag/header to dict.
def getAddressAndEtag(filename, bot_data):
    addressAndEtag = {}
    with open(filename) as file:
        for item in bot_data['post'][::-1]:
            item_body = item['body'].split()
            if item_body[0] == 'add-feed':
                addressAndEtag[item_body[1]] = ''
            elif item_body[0] == 'del-feed':
                del(addressAndEtag[item_body[1]])
            else:
                break

        for line in file:
            line = line.split(None, 1)
            if len(line) == 2:
                addressAndEtag[line[0]] = line[1].rstrip() #remove trailing whitespace
            else:
                addressAndEtag[line[0]] = ''
    return addressAndEtag


#Fetch Feeds and Renew rssAddresses.txt
def getFeedAndRenewAddr(addressAndEtag):
    feedOutput = []
    for addr in addressAndEtag:
        last_entry_date = 0
        etag = addressAndEtag[addr]
        if etag == '':
            rssfeeds = feedparser.parse(addr)
        elif etag[0:4] == 'etag':
            rssfeeds = feedparser.parse(addr, etag = etag[4:])
        elif etag[0:4] == 'lmod':
            rssfeeds = feedparser.parse(addr, modified = etag[4:])
        else:
            rssfeeds = feedparser.parse(addr)
            last_entry_date = int(etag)

        unix_time_list = []
        for entry in rssfeeds.entries:
            unix_time = int(time.mktime(entry.published_parsed))
            if unix_time > last_entry_date:
                feedOutput += [{'timestamp': unix_time,
                        #'summary': html2text.html2text(entry.summary),
                        'title': entry.title.replace('\u0102\u017a','\u00fc').\
                                replace('\u0102\u00a4', '\u00e4'),
                        'link': entry.link}]
                unix_time_list.append(unix_time)
        if unix_time_list != []:
            last_entry_date = max(unix_time_list)

        # Update etag
        if rssfeeds.get('etag') != None:
            addressAndEtag[addr] = 'etag' + rssfeeds.etag
        elif rssfeeds.get('modified') != None: # update last-modified headers instead
            addressAndEtag[addr] = 'lmod' + rssfeeds.modified
        elif last_entry_date != 0:
            print(addr, 'doesn\'t support etag, remove it if you need to save bandwidth and power')
            addressAndEtag[addr] = str(last_entry_date)

    # Renew rssAddresses.txt
    os.rename('rssAddresses.txt','rssAddresses.txt.backup')  # backup rssAddresses.txt
    with open("rssAddresses.txt", "w") as file:
        for addr in addressAndEtag:
            file.write(addr + ' ' + addressAndEtag[addr] + '\n')

    return feedOutput


if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Set working dir to ZeroNet/Feedbot
    getdir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(inspect.stack()[0][1]))  # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/918154/relative-paths-in-python
    os.chdir(getdir)

    sign_command_path = SITE_ADDRESS + ' ' + '--inner_path' + ' ' + 'data/users/' + \
            AUTH_ADDRESS + '/content.json'
    data_json = '../data/' + SITE_ADDRESS + '/data/users/' + AUTH_ADDRESS + '/data.json'

    bot_data = json.loads(open(data_json).read().replace("\\u0000", ""))

    addressAndEtag = getAddressAndEtag("rssAddresses.txt", bot_data)
    feedOutput = getFeedAndRenewAddr(addressAndEtag)


    if feedOutput != []:
        feedOutput = sorted(feedOutput, key=lambda entry: entry['timestamp'])

        # Renew data.json
        for entry in feedOutput:
            bot_data['post'] += [{
                    'post_id': entry['timestamp'],
                    'body': entry['title'] + '\n' + entry['link'],
                    'date_added': entry['timestamp']
            }]
        bot_data['next_post_id'] = len(bot_data['post']) + 1
        json.dump(bot_data, open(data_json, "w"), indent=2)

        # Sign and publish content
        siteSign = subprocess.Popen("python2 ../zeronet.py siteSign" + " " + sign_command_path,
                shell=True, stdin=subprocess.PIPE)  # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/163542/python-how-do-i-pass-a-string-into-subprocess-popen-using-the-stdin-argument
        siteSign.communicate(input=AUTH_KEY)[0]
        subprocess.Popen("python2 ../zeronet.py sitePublish" + " " + sign_command_path,
                shell=True).stdout
    else:
        print("No new Feed.")
```

(copy) **zeronet-mastodon-bridge.py**

```
#! /usr/bin/env python

# Test with Mastodon.py-1.0.7

from mastodon import Mastodon
from html2text import html2text

import os
import subprocess
import inspect
from datetime import datetime
import time
import json

SITE_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_ADDRESS = ''
AUTH_KEY = b''  # key needs to be byte

MASTODON_SITE = ''

# Timezone offset
if time.localtime().tm_isdst and time.daylight:  # https://blogs.gnome.org/jamesh/2006/12/31/python-timetimezone-timealtzone-edge-case/
    OFFSET = -time.altzone
else:
    OFFSET = -time.timezone


def returnLastTimestamp(mastodon):
    account_id = mastodon.account_verify_credentials()['id']
    status_data = mastodon.account_statuses(account_id)
    timestamp = status_data[0]['created_at']
    timestamp = datetime.strptime(timestamp, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ").timestamp()
    timestamp += OFFSET
    return timestamp


def accessToMastodon(data_json):
    if not os.path.isfile('pytooter_clientcred.txt'):  # just need to run one time
        new_masto_app = Mastodon.create_app(
                client_name = 'ZeroMe Bridge',
                api_base_url = MASTODON_SITE,
                to_file = 'pytooter_clientcred.txt'
                )
        mastodon_client = Mastodon(
                client_id = 'pytooter_clientcred.txt',
                api_base_url = MASTODON_SITE
                )
        mastodon_client.log_in(
                username = input('please input your username (email) of Mastodon account: '),
                password = input('please input your password of Mastodon account: '),
                to_file = 'pytooter_usercred.txt'
                )

        # Also create a file last_timestamps.txt
        mastodon = Mastodon(
                client_id = 'pytooter_clientcred.txt',
                access_token = 'pytooter_usercred.txt',
                api_base_url = MASTODON_SITE
                )

        zerome_data = json.loads(open(data_json).read().replace("\\u0000", ""))
        timestamp0 = zerome_data['post'][-1]['date_added']
        timestamp1 = returnLastTimestamp(mastodon)

        with open('last_timestamps.txt', 'w') as file:
            file.write(str(timestamp0) + '\n' + str(timestamp1) + '\n')

def ZeroMeToMastodon(zerome_data, mastodon):
    with open('last_timestamps.txt') as file:
        last_timestamps = []
        for line in file:
            last_timestamps.append(line)
    last_timestamp = int(last_timestamps[0])  # first line timestamp for ZeroMe posts
    reversed_post_data = zerome_data['post'][::-1]
    new_last_timestamp = reversed_post_data[0]['date_added']

    if new_last_timestamp > last_timestamp:
        posts = []
        for item in reversed_post_data:
            if item['date_added'] > last_timestamp:
                posts.append(item['body'])
            else:
                break
        # push post to Mastodon chronologically
        for post in posts[::-1]:
            mastodon.toot(post) # waiting for markdown support ...

        # update last_timestamps.txt
        last_timestamps[0] = str(new_last_timestamp) + '\n'
        last_timestamps[1] = str(returnLastTimestamp(mastodon)) + '\n'
        with open('last_timestamps.txt', 'w') as file:
            for timestamp in last_timestamps:
                file.write(timestamp)


def MastodonToZeroMe(mastodon, zerome_data, data_json):
    with open('last_timestamps.txt') as file:
        last_timestamps = []
        for line in file:
            last_timestamps.append(line)
    last_timestamp = float(last_timestamps[1])  # second line timestamp for Mastodon posts
    account_id = mastodon.account_verify_credentials()['id']
    status_data = mastodon.account_statuses(account_id)
    date_time = status_data[0]['created_at']  # not calling returnLastTimestamp to save time
    new_last_timestamp = datetime.strptime(date_time, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ").timestamp()
    new_last_timestamp += OFFSET
    if new_last_timestamp > last_timestamp:
        statuses = []
        for item in status_data:
            timestamp = datetime.strptime(item['created_at'], "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ").timestamp()
            timestamp += OFFSET
            if timestamp > last_timestamp:
                statuses += [{
                        'post_id': int(timestamp),
                        'body': html2text(item['content']),
                        'date_added': int(timestamp)
                        }]
            else:
                break
        # push post to ZeroMe chronologically
        zerome_data['post'] += statuses[::-1]
        zerome_data['next_post_id'] = len(zerome_data['post']) + 1
        json.dump(zerome_data, open(data_json, "w"), indent=2)
        sign_command_path = SITE_ADDRESS + ' ' + '--inner_path' + ' ' + 'data/users/' + \
                AUTH_ADDRESS + '/content.json'
        # Sign and publish content
        siteSign = subprocess.Popen("python2 ../zeronet.py siteSign" + " " + sign_command_path,
                shell=True, stdin=subprocess.PIPE)  # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/163542/python-how-do-i-pass-a-string-into-subprocess-popen-using-the-stdin-argument
        siteSign.communicate(input=AUTH_KEY)[0]
        subprocess.Popen("python2 ../zeronet.py sitePublish" + " " + sign_command_path,
                shell=True).stdout

        # update last_timestamps.txt
        last_timestamps[0] = str(int(new_last_timestamp)) + '\n'
        last_timestamps[1] = str(new_last_timestamp) + '\n'
        with open('last_timestamps.txt', 'w') as file:
            for timestamp in last_timestamps:
                file.write(timestamp)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Set working dir
    getdir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(inspect.stack()[0][1]))  # http://stackoverflow.com/questions/918154/relative-paths-in-python
    os.chdir(getdir)

    data_json = '../data/' + SITE_ADDRESS + '/data/users/' + AUTH_ADDRESS + '/data.json'
    accessToMastodon(data_json)

    mastodon = Mastodon(
            client_id = 'pytooter_clientcred.txt',
            access_token = 'pytooter_usercred.txt',
            api_base_url = MASTODON_SITE
            )

    zerome_data = json.loads(open(data_json).read().replace("\\u0000", ""))

    ZeroMeToMastodon(zerome_data, mastodon)
    MastodonToZeroMe(mastodon, zerome_data, data_json)
```
